meanings.definition: To reduce to atoms or small particles.
meanings.sent1: The powerful machine atomizes the metal into tiny pieces.
meanings.sent2: The blender atomizes the fruits to make a smoothie.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's laser vision atomizes any obstacle in his way.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds atomize the sand on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The explosion atomizes the building into rubble.

meanings.definition: To break down into smaller components.
meanings.sent1: The enzyme atomizes the food into nutrients for the body.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the sun's heat can atomize rocks into sand.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seems to atomize the card into thin air.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes atomize the colors into a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation atomizes the complex topic into simple ideas.

meanings.sent1: The old book starts to atomize as its pages crumble.
meanings.sent2: The ancient statue slowly atomizes due to weathering over time.
meanings.sent3: The loud music seems to atomize my concentration into bits.
meanings.sent4: The ice cream cone atomizes in the hot sun, dripping down the sides.
meanings.sent5: The fragile glass easily atomizes when dropped on the floor.
